intro: Tapeinidium amplum, commonly known as the giant flame vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, orange-red flowers that resemble flames. The plant produces long, slender, woody stems that can grow up to several meters in length. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate with a slightly hairy surface. The flowers are typically borne in clusters and are pollinated by birds and insects.
